intro: Palicourea gibbosa, commonly known as the roughleaf palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
